titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Louis O. Kunkel papers, Rockefeller University Faculty FA172
titlestmt.author: Gladys Lewis

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-11-01 01:24:13 -0400.

did.unittitle: Louis O. Kunkel papers, Rockefeller University Faculty

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Louis Otto Kunkel, 1884-1960, at the RU (formerly RIMR) from 1931-1960. As Pathologist at the Bureau of Plant Industry, U.S. Department of Agriculture he conducted investigative work on virus diseases of the potato. As Associate Pathologist at the Hawaiian Sugar Planters' Association his studies were on viral diseases of sugar cane and their insect vectors. As Pathologist at the Boyce-Thompson Institute for Plant Research he developed a diversified program of studies on viral diseases of plants and became interested in the "yellows" type of plant diseases and the insect vectors involved in such disease. This general area of research constituted his main interest for the rest of his life. In 1931 Dr. Kunkel became head of RIMR Department of Plant Pathology at Princeton. In 1949 when Princeton laboratories were merged with New York City laboratories, he came to New York to continue his work. In 1956 he received the Certificate of Merit award at the Golden Jubilee meeting of the Botanical Society of America and in 1959 the Distinguished Service award of the New York Botanical Garden. His was a lifetime of outstanding research and administration in plant pathology, mainly in the field of virology.

eventgrp.event: Born May 7 Audrain County near Mexico, Mo.
B.S. in Education, State University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo.
A.B. State University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo.
A.M. State University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo. 1909-1911 Assistant in botany, State University of Missouri, Columbia, Mo.
Graduate student, Washington University, St. Louis, Mo.
Research fellow in the Henry Shaw School of Botany, Washington University, St. Louis, Mo.
Graduate student, Columbia University, New York, N.Y.
Assistant in botany, Columbia University
Research assistant in botany, Columbia University
Ph. D. Columbia University, N.Y.
Cutting traveling fellow from Columbia University
Pathologist, Bureau of Plant Industry, U.S. Dept. of Agriculture, Washington, D.C.
Associate pathologist, Hawaiian Sugar Planters' Association, Hawaii
Pathologist, Boyce Thompson Institute for Plant Research, Yonkers, N.Y.
Elected member, National Academy of Sciences
Member and Head of Plant Pathology, RIMR Princeton, N.J.
Professor emeritus RU: Princeton and New York City laboratories merged
Retired as administrator and devoted all of his time to research
Died March 20 Newtown, Pa.
Received the Certificate of Merit award at the Golden Jubilee meeting of the Botanical Society of America
Distinguished Service award of The New York Botanical Garden

bioghist.p: Member of: National Academy of Sciences, American Philosophical Society, Botanical Society of America, American Psychopathological Society, Phi Beta Kappa, Sigma Xi, American Society of Naturalists, American Institute of the City of New York, Society of American Bacteriologists: (1942-1943 President of Theobald Smith Society, N.J. branch of; also on program committee), National Geographic Society (membership certificate with biographical material in Box no. 1), Torrey Botanical Club

Served as Member of the Board of National Research Fellowships in the Biological Sciences for the National Research Council, Member of the American Advisory Council for Yenching University at Peiping, China, Member of the Advisory Council of the Department of Biology, Princeton University, Member of the Committee to visit the Division of Biology for the Board of Overseers of Harvard College (1934-1941), Member of the Board of Managers (1952-1961) and member of the Scientific Committee (1953-1957) for the New York Botanical Garden, Member of Council of Awards of The American Institute of the City of New York, Associate editor of Phytopathology (1931-1934)

Family History. Parents: Mr. Henry Kunkel and Mrs. Katie Price (Spencer) Kunkel of Mexico, Mo., 1915 Sept. 4 married Johanna Caroline Wortmann, Children: (4 sons): Henry George, Otto Wortmann, Walter Ralph, Paul Spencer
Secondary sources for Louis O. Kunkel:
G.C. Ainsworth, Introduction to the history of plant pathology (Cambridge: Cambridge University Press, 1981).
Includes biographical references, bibliography (arranged chronologically) and "Some landmarks in the history of plant pathology."

There are, however, two mistakes regarding Kunkel's appointment: 1) p. 95. Kunkel was not the first Director of the Department of Animal and Plant Pathology. Carl Ten Broeck was director (not the first; Theobald Smith, 1916), appointed in 1930. Kunkel was appointed director of the Division of Plant Pathology, 1931. 2) p. 139. In 1935 Kunkel was no longer at the Boyce Thompson Institute, but at RIMR.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The papers of Louis Otto Kunkel were deposited with the Rockefeller University Archives on 1975 by RU plant Pathology Department.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted pending permission from Rockefeller University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Types of records include: biographical material, subject files, notes, slides, negatives, and reprints.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Personal and career development correspondence; obituary material; photographs; annual reports to corporation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence. with E.B. Smith and Simon Flexner leading to L.O. Kunkel appointment as Member of RIMR Princeton with Flexner, Smith and Kunkel holographs.

Including: Letters of congratulations on appointment as Head of Plant Pathology, RIMR Princeton and on being elected Member of the National Academy of Sciences (Includes letters from W.V.J. Osterhaut and C.S. Gager).

did.unittitle: Vita - [Original copy L.O. Kunkel to E.B. Smith with corrected copy]
news item announcing appointment as head of Plant Pathology, RIMR Princeton
1932 July 1, 21. Theobald Smith holographs about diseased pine trees with 1932 July 8 Kunkel reply
typescript of Science Service radio talk "Pests away from home"
reprint of "Aster yellows and its control". A brief summary of the work of L.O. Kunkel in solving an important growers' problem by Zeliaette Troy of Boyce Thompson Institute
Who's Who in the Western Hemisphere
typescripts of lectures delivered at Cornell University, Ithaca, NY as visiting lecturer: "Summaries of discussions of plant virus diseases" and "The nature of viruses"
correspondence. with Day and Zimmerman - biographical sketch for government security clearance
statement of Kunkel research work at RIMR for archives

National Academy of Sciences meeting at RIMR. Typescripts of abstract and paper delivered "Acquired immunity from infection by strains of aster-yellows virus in the aster leafhopper" with typescript of Kunkel demonstration
Kunkel bibliography (1912-1961, 9 pages) and Kunkel photographs 1931, 1948, 1956
"Some plant disease work currently in progress"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily with E.B. Smith and some with W.B. Flinn about building and laboratory construction; personnel; staff appointments; salaries; budgets and expenditures; publications; grants-in-aid to various journals; attending RIMR NYC seminars and luncheons.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes special interest items: 1942 June 22-27. 75th anniversary celebration of the Torrey Botanical Club. Dr. Kunkel RIMR representative. 1955 Sept. 23 typescript copy of statement to Dr. Rivers "Summary of researches of L.O. Kunkel." [Original in Box no. 1].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence about staff appointments; Meeting: 1931 Oct. 30 RIMR Trustees Annual meeting. Paper delivered on plant pathology; National Research Council grant recommendation for Professor Vinson.
Includes statement on "Incubation periods of plant viruses in insect vectors" for Dr. Flexner and congratulations on Dr. Flexner 80 birthday.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence about staff appointments; Gasser letter of appreciation on AAAS awards to members of Kunkel department; promotion recommendation for Armin Braun with report of Braun's investigative work and summary of Karl Maramoroch's investigative work.
Includes 1939 Oct. 18 list of scientific contributions of Kunkel department on "Plant diseases".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence about plant virus exhibit on 1935 Apr 18 American Assoc. of Pathologists and Bacteriologists/American Assoc. of Immunologists meeting on Virus symposium. Meeting: 1942 May Ithaca, N.Y. Cornell Univ. Messenger lectures. Paper delivered "New hosts as a key to progress in plant virus disease research".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence about visits to Princeton; personnel; scientific staff and appointments; laboratory equipment; annual reports; journals.

Includes special interest items: Lecture: 1932 Mar 21 RIMR Princeton staff seminar; 1932 Oct. 24 brief biographical and work outline of Holmes, Osborn, Stanley, White, Price, Spencer, Thornberry, Jensen, Plantenga; recommendations for T. Laskaris; A.F. Blakeslee; I.P. Norval; report and praise of Braun investigative work 1938-1941; Ten Broeck holographs.
Includes Correspondence with M. Swift/ Ten Broeck concerning Pinus Bunglana and the Gundstone Tamopan.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence primarily with C.P. Spies and some with E.H. Turner about purchasing laboratory and greenhouse equipment and supplies.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with E.C. Campbell and F.M. Stewart concerning Dr. Kunkel and staff publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Early correspondence is addressed to Dr. Kunkel at Boyce Thompson. Correspondence deals largely with an exchange of scientific information about plant virus diseases, exchange of samples of diseased and healthy plants for experimental purposes and identification, and an exchange of samples of cultures and seeds. Further correspondence is about attendance to scientific meetings and frequent presentation of papers. Dr. Kunkel attends many meetings of the American Phytopathological Society and American Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS).
Includes Correspondence about manuscripts for publication and many requests for reprints of Kunkel published papers; many job inquiries. Dr. Kunkel displays a keen sense of humor with friends.
Includes some administrative Correspondence relating to staff appointments (filed under name of appointee).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Academic Press and Max Lauffer, Editor; contract with Academic Press; notice to contributors; printer's page proof of contribution; advertising leaflet of Vol. 1, Advances in Virus Research. Manuscript: In relation to chapter title "Cross-protection between strains of yellow-type viruses" in Vol. III Advances in Virus Research 1955 pp. 251-273.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Includes Correspondence about 1935 ca. Dec 23 address to council members of The American Phytopathological Society concerning details of certain editorial policies.

did.unittitle: International Congress for Microbiology, 3rd Meeting: NYC Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Dr. Kunkel on executive committee involved in organizing Congress. Also a vice-president of Section III on Viruses and viral disease.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paper delivered "Virus mutations". Includes Kunkel recommendations for paper presentation by T. Fukushi and H.H. Storey.

Includes pamphlet of Congress announcement and typescripts of Kunkel statements made in discussing Smith and McKinney papers. At this meeting Committee on description and nomenclature of plant viruses met jointly with Committee on description and nomenclature of animal viruses for discussion. (See under: International Committee on Description and nomenclature of plant viruses Box no. 9).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr. Kunkel retires as member of Board of National Research Fellowships in the Biological Sciences. Also served as member-at-large of the Division of Biology and Agriculture. Consists primarily of Correspondence with various members of board dealing with granting fellowships.
Includes fellowship recommendations for: T.E. Rawlins, C.G. Vinson, A. Hollaender, L.K. Jones, I.D. Dobroscky and L.M. Black.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Actively involved as member of various functioning administrative bodies of the N.Y. Botanical Garden and attends graduations and other functions involving N.Y. Botanical Garden.

Includes: Member of Board of Managers, 1952-1961; Elected member of corporation in 1951 to elect Managers; Member of scientific committee 1953-1957; Recommendation of J.M. Fogg to Board of Managers; Includes also: typescripts of Dept reports and Foundations for 1956-57 appeals; Laboratory Research brochure; NY Botanical Garden reception for graduates. Kunkel awards certificates and gives small talk, June 20, 1957; 1960 a preliminary draft of a memorandum by Wm. C. Steere, Director "Planning for the New York Botanical Garden through the years" marked "Tentative and Confidential"; and pamphlet "Program of exploration in South America 1960-1969".

scopecontent.p: Correspondence about: 1933 Apr 18 Princeton, N.J. RIMR Dept of Animal and Plant Pathology Kunkel demonstration on "Isolation of pure cultures from mixtures of the viruses of tobacco and aucuba mosaics" with program of meeting; evaluations of W.C. Price and W.M. Stanley work with recommendation for Sigma Xi awards for Price and Stanley; Lectures: Arrangements for 1937 June Sigma Xi lecture series "Frontiers in Science". Paper delivered "New views in virus disease research". Presented at Palo Alto, Calif. Stanford Univ. (June 1), Palo Alto, Calif. Stanford Univ. (June 4), Columbia, Mo. Univ. of Mo. (June 8). Published in 1939 in "Science in Progress" by Yale Univ. Press.
Also includes some duplicated material announcing meetings, nominations, lectures, speakers, topics.
1942 Nov 17 typescript of minute in memory of Wade Brown by Louise Pearce, R.W. Glaser and L.O. Kunkel. Prepared for Sigma Xi.

Paper delivered "Isolation of mild strains of aster yellows from heat-treated leafhoppers" with typescript of abstract. 1945 June 16 New Brunswick NJ Joint meeting of NJ and NYC branches of the Society of American Bacteriologists. Paper delivered "A new yellows disease of carrots". Also includes 1942 Oct pamphlet of the Theobald Smith Society with review of 1941-1942; officers and committees, directory of members.

Includes Kunkel attends: 1933 Oct 26 Princeton, N.J. RIMR dinner honoring Dr. Robbins given by botanical group at Princeton; 1934 Nov 28-29. 25 anniversary reunion and 1949 ca. May 40 anniversary reunion of Class of 1909 University of Missouri.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: At RIMR from 1933 Dec for several months

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seminar: 1933 Feb. 6 New Brunswick, N.J. Agricultural Experiment Station, Dept of Soil Microbiology seminar. Paper delivered "The historical development of our knowledge of plant viruses"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes: Meetings: 1935 ca. Apr 23 Washington, D.C. NAS meeting; 1935 Apr. 24 Washington, D.C. Botanical Society of Washington symposium on virus diseases of animals and plants. Paper delivered "Summary of plant virus diseases".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs of slides showing the structures resembling intracellular bodies with memorandums concerning slides.
Includes Kunkel's comments and suggestions on slides, investigative work and mss.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes typescript of Kunkel review of "A textbook of plant virus diseases" by Kenneth M. Smith, P. Blakiston's Son & Co. , Inc. Philadelphia 1937 [Editor's note: This review is not included with Kunkel bibliography].

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Indicates Kunkel biography included in 1953 Fifth Edition of World Biography, copy not included.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: See also under: Smith, K.M. letter of recommendation for Smith in Box no. 14

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Professional Correspondence between colleagues socially friendly. Includes: Meeting: 1942 June 24 Yonkers, NY Boyce Thompson Institute, Torrey Botanical Club anniversary meeting. Paper delivered "on viruses in relation to growth in plants".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographic prints of various virus diseased plants with experimental data (loose leaf covers removed - some years lacking) ; includes literature searches of virus disease literature to and including 1929.

did.unittitle: Virus disease literature to and including 1929

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Includes: subject index pp i-ii; author index pp iii-ixxviii; literature citations pp 1-276. Stapled items found in duplicate copy (inserted where found) ; other items found in original copy and kept in order found (papers and references).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notebooks containing photographic prints with experimental work descriptions of virus diseases in plants; some tables.

Includes table of contents; index to prints listing page number; lantern slide number (lantern slides 1928-1945 only) and negative number (negatives 1933-1956 only) ; some negatives found. (Description from original loose leaf covers). There are lapses in dates of notebooks (some years lacking).

did.unittitle: Includes 3 pages of table of contents; 2 pages lantern slide and negative index; pp 1-69 of photographs with experiments
Peach yellows, rosette, potato malnutrition, tomato spotted wilt etc.
